lines.content: * The main class of the Terry task manager application. This class initializes the user interface,
* loads tasks from the storage, processes user input commands, and interacts with other components
* such as task list, storage, and UI.
* The maximum number of words to split a command line into, used for processing user input.

* @throws TerryException If an error occurs during command processing or other operations.

* The {@code Parser} class is responsible for processing user commands,
* parsing task information, and handling task creation from saved files.

* @param storage  The storage instance for saving tasks.
* @throws TerryException If the input format is invalid or unknown.
Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TerryException {

* Parses a task from a saved file format and reconstructs it.
* @param line The line of text from the saved file containing task details.
* @return The reconstructed task, or {@code null} if the format is invalid.
* Handles saving and loading tasks from a file
* Saves the list of tasks to a file.
* If the file does not exist, it is created.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be saved.
System.out.println("An error occurred while creating the file.");
* Writes the given list of tasks to the file.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be written.
System.out.println("An error occurred while writing to the file");
* Loads tasks from the file and adds them to the task list.
* If the file does not exist, no tasks are loaded.
* @param tasks The list where the loaded tasks will be stored.
System.out.println("An error occurred while reading the file");
* Represents a Deadline task, which has a description and a deadline time.
* The deadline time for this task.
* Constructs a Deadline task with the given description and deadline time.
* The task is initially unmarked (not completed).
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by The deadline time for the task.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task.
* The format includes the task's status, description and the deadline time.
* @return A string representation of the Deadline task.
* Returns the string format used for saving this task.
* The format follows: D | marked status | description | deadline time.
* @return A string in the format for saving the Deadline task.
* Represents an Event task, which has a description and a time range (from and to).
* The starting time of the event.
* The ending time of the event.
* Constructs an Event task with the given description, starting time, and ending time.
* The task is initially unmarked (not completed).
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The starting time of the event.
* @param to The ending time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event task.
* The format includes the task's status, description, the starting time, and the ending time.
* @return A string representation of the Event task.
* Returns the string format used for saving this task.
* The format follows: E | marked status | description | starting time and ending time.
* @return A string in the format for saving the Event task.
* Represents a task with a description and a marked status.
* The task can be marked as complete or incomplete
* The description or input for this task.
* Indicates whether the task is marked as completed or not.
* Constructs a Task with the given description.
* The task is initially unmarked (not completed).
* @param input The description of the task.
* Returns the description of the task.
* @return The input description of the task.
* Checks if the task is marked as completed.
* @return {@code true} if the task is marked, otherwise {@code false}.
* Sets the status of the task to marked or unmarked.
* @param isMarked {@code true} to mark the task as completed, {@code false} to unmark it.
* Returns a string representation of the task's status icon.
* Displays "[X]" if the task is marked as completed, and "[ ]" if not.
* Returns a string representation of the Task object.
* The format includes the task's status icon and description.
* @return A string representation of the Task.
* Returns the string format used for saving this task.
* The format follows: T | marked status | description.
* @return A string in the format for saving the Task.
* Searches for tasks containing a given keyword in their description.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in the task descriptions.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to search through.
* @return A list of tasks that contain the keyword in their description.
public List<Task> findTasksByKeyword(String keyword, List<Task> tasks) {
* Represents a ToDo task, which is a simple task with a description and a marked status.
* Constructs a ToDo task with the given description.
* The task is initially unmarked (not completed).
* @param description The description of the ToDo task.
* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task.
* The format includes the task's status and description.
* @return A string representation of the ToDo task.
* Returns the string format used for saving this ToDo task.
* The format follows: T | marked status | description.
* @return A string in the format for saving the ToDo task.
* Represents a list of tasks that a user interacts with, providing methods
* to add, remove, mark, unmark, and retrieve tasks. It also handles
* storage of tasks through the {@link Storage} class.
* The list of tasks that are managed by the user.
* The {@link Storage} instance used to save and load tasks.
* Constructs a UserInputList with an empty task list and a new Storage instance.
* Loads tasks from the file upon initialization.
* Adds a new task to the list and saves the updated list to the file.
* @param task The task to add to the list.
* Removes the task at the specified index from the list and saves the updated list to the file.
* The index is 1-based (i.e., 1 corresponds to the first task in the list).
* @param index The index of the task to remove.
* Marks the task at the specified index as completed and saves the updated list to the file.
* The index is 1-based (i.e., 1 corresponds to the first task in the list).
* @param index The index of the task to mark.
* Unmarks the task at the specified index (marks as incomplete) and saves the updated list to the file.
* The index is 1-based (i.e., 1 corresponds to the first task in the list).
* @param index The index of the task to unmark.
* Returns the full list of tasks.
* Returns a sublist containing only the task at the specified index (1-based index).
* @param index The index of the task to retrieve (1-based).
* @return A sublist containing the task at the specified index, or null if the index is invalid.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* @return The size of the task list.
* This class handles user interface (UI) interactions, including displaying
* welcome messages, task lists, task details, and exit messages. It works with
* the {@link UserInputList} and {@link Task} classes to print relevant information.
* Prints a welcome message to the user when the program starts.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Prints a separator line used for formatting UI output.
* Prints a confirmation message after a new task is added, including the task
* details and the updated size of the task list.
* @param list The {@link UserInputList} containing the tasks.
* @param newTask The task that was added.
public void printTasks(UserInputList list, Task newTask) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + newTask);
* Prints the number of tasks currently in the task list.
* @param list The {@link UserInputList} containing the tasks.
System.out.println("Now you have " + list.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints an exit message when the user exits the application.
* Prints the entire list of tasks, with each task displayed along with its index.
* If the task list is empty, a message indicating so is displayed.
* @param userInputList The {@link UserInputList} containing the tasks.
* Prints the task at the specified index. The index is 1-based, meaning the first task
* in the list has index 1. If the index is out of bounds, an error message is displayed.
* @param userInputList The {@link UserInputList} containing the tasks.
* @param index The index of the task to display.
public void printIndex(UserInputList userInputList, int index) {
* Prints the task at the specified index without displaying the index number.
* If the index is out of bounds, an error message is displayed.
* @param userInputList The {@link UserInputList} containing the tasks.
* @param index The index of the task to display.
public void printIndexWithoutNumber(UserInputList userInputList, int index) {

* If no matching tasks are found, a message indicating so is displayed.
* @param tasks The list of tasks that match the search criteria.
